body.p: This procedure uses tone curve, channel mixer and split-toning modules.

ol.li:
Image preparation
Prepare the image for the cross process steps by adjusting the base settings such as exposure, whitebalance etc. for a correctly looking image.

Boost contrast
Select the medium contrast curve preset for tone curvemodule ( Tone curve) to boost the overall contrast in the image. You might later return here to tune the curve for better result.

Color cast This step changes the color cast as the base for the effect using the channel mixermodule ( Channel mixer). You might later again return to this and finetune the colorcast of the final result.
Enable the channel mixer module
Select the blue channel and set the blue color value to 0.8
Select the red channel and change the blue color value to 0.1
Select the green channel and change the blue color value to 0.1

split-toning
We use split-toning( split-toning) to add some more coloring to the result for cyan/blue shadows and yellow highlight.
Enable the split-toning module
Select a cyan/blue tone for shadows and set saturation around 50%
Select a yellow/orange tone for highlights and set saturation around 70%
Set compression to 10%
Use the balance slider to tune the split-toning effect. This differs on every image due to it's exposure, motive etc.
